Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDauenheimer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I returned from a six night stay in this charming hotel. We stayed for nine nights last year and we were happy to return. In addition to a great location, our room was very comfortable, inviting and very important-quiet. You can have coffee (3 euros) or breakfast (13 euros) bought up the room-a lovely way to start the day! The island is a perfect location with restaurants, shops, bakeries and supermarket all close by. The staff, especially the very kind Arif, were very helpful and made us feel very much at home. We look forward to returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another very pleasant visit”
Reviews.Author: teacher050
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth stay at the Hotel de Lutece, which is located on the very busy, very touristy Ile St. Louis. I hadn't been a guest at the hotel since 2001, and I had forgotten how very charming the hotel is. I have sampled the variety of accommodation available: single room, double room, duplex triple. I like them all equally, although the duplex is pretty special. My daughter joined me on this stay and we occupied a very comfortable double room with twin beds. Our room faced the courtyard, so we weren't bothered by street noise. The floor to ceiling curtains were very attractive and our beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom (shower only) was spacious and spotless. Breakfast, the only meal offered, is in a small room just off the reception area. The price is a bit high (13 euros), but there is a lot of food: croissants, baguettes, cheese, yogurt, cold meat, boiled eggs, juice, and a variety of hot beverages. If this sounds like way too much food or money, there is boulangerie directly across the street, as well as many cafes in the area. One need not spend nearly $20 for one breakfast. The staff is warm and welcoming. I was especially touched by the greeting one of the staff gave me during breakfast. I hadn't been a guest at the hotel in over 10 years, but I was hugged and kissed by a maid who had remembered me. She was genuinely happy to see me again. I was truly touched. The only down side, perhaps, to the hotel is its location on a very narrow street that is a favorite area, it seems, for American tourists. If you've come to Paris hoping to speak French or be in the company of Parisians exclusively, this is not the area for that. On the other hand, if you find comfort in lots and lots of people from the States and Parisians who are happy to speak English to you, this location is ideal. I like the area because I feel completely safe when I'm traveling alone. The hotel's street is self contained, with nearly a dozen restaurants (including the very popular Cafe St. Regis) and tons of boutiques and other shops. Notre Dame is within a five minute walk; the closest metro, Pont Marie, is just across the bridge. AND, there are several Berthillon ice cream shops along the rue St.- Louis-en-l'Ile.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location on the Ile St. Louis”
Reviews.Author: kathy1966
Reviews.Content: My husband and son (age 10) stayed at this great property in room 553, a triple with windows facing the rear. Because of the location of the room, it was quiet. The bathroom has been updated with shower and stone tiled floors. Toiletries include small generic soap and shampoo and a wimpy hair dryer is provided. The room size was adequate as we did not expect spacious quarters based on other reviews. Mattress comfort (hard) typical of what we found to be standard in most hotels in France, even at the four star Trianon Palace in Versailles. The location on the island was perfect. It is close to Metro stops, great restaurants, Berthillion, a supermarket next door, boulangeries, and great little shops. We ate at L' Ange close to the Centre Pompidou, Au Bougnat by Notre Dame, and hit Berthillion multiple times. Great stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, nice hotel, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Squeezl
Reviews.Content: Ile St Louis is our new favorite area to stay in Paris. The island is lovely and romantic. The street is lined with nice restaurants and shops. Notre Dame, Left Bank and Marais are close as well as convenient metro stops St Michel, Cite and Hotel de Ville. Even on day trips farther afield we really enjoyed walking from the metro stop back to "our island". Hotel de Lutece is very nice, very well maintained and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Yes the room size is small compared to US hotels, but it's typical of or even a little better than most small hotels in Paris. You should expect this. In fact our bathroom was comparatively large. Note there is a tiny but well stocked market right next door, convenient to grab some wine and snacks for the room. Prices are high for Paris, but this is true for all hotels on the island and for the area this hotel is good value. Ile St Louis is not the area for a budget trip to Paris, but well worth it for a romantic get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Charming area and hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jld44
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Hotel de Lutece several times on business. Let me fist say that the area is unbeatable. I'lle Saint Louis is very beautiful, right beside the river seine, and is so romantic. The street that the hotel is on has some charming restaurants and shops. It's very close to Notre Damn with plenty of metro stations nearby including St Michel and Cite. It's close very close the the Marais which is beautiful. The hotel itself is nice and clean. It has plenty of character and charm. The staff are really helpful and friendly. I couldn't recommend it enough. I'd say it's ideal for a romantic weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: FMQ55
Reviews.Content: Good location, rooms very small and could do with tea/coffee making facilities. I was here in September and had booked a twin room. The space between the two beds was probably all of 5cm. I know the size of the room is typical of Paris but I think you could do better for amenities and pay less.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: kgs1958
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel in a wonderful location. The staff is helpful and friendly. The room was small, but if you're organized, that shouldn't be an issue. And it was quiet and clean. I had only one problem, and that was the bed, which I found horribly uncomfortable. Horribly. When I was younger, it probably wouldn't have been a problem, but I'm not; and as it was, I had a hard time sleeping and a sore back the whole next day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small boutique hotel,perfect location in a nice quiet surrounding.”
Reviews.Author: Cathey13
Reviews.Content: The location,the room, spacey renovated bathroom since we've been 3 girls traveling. Other reviews wrote too small elevator but for anyone who knows Paris,it is everywhere like this. We didn't book the breakfast,since at the corner is a very nice & typical French bistro St.Regis which we just loved,it was perfect for breakfast or lunch or just a quick coffee.On day of check-out we overslept,and did checkout an hour later which was no problem at all. RER metro station just 10 min away, closest metro station 2min Pont Marie.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay if you like quiet places”
Reviews.Author: Marcos_Barbosa
Reviews.Content: This charm hotel, in the heart of Paris, is extremely silent and quiet. The staff is very friendly and the rooms, despite a little small, are very clean and comfortable. It is a great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Antonia39
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its location smack in the middle of the Ile St. Louis. It was a great experience.The hotel is on the main street of the island amid wonderful shops, boutiques and restaurants. It's a great base for walking tours of the city and reasonably close to the Metro. Our room on the top floor was small but charming. It had an open beam ceiling and great views of the neighboring rooftops and street below. Not much room for the suitcases but tons of closet space. The bathroom was quite large and comfortable with heated floors. I can't say enough about the staff - very friendly and super helpful. I was sick for a couple of days, and they brought me medicine and room service. The breakfasts are a bit expensive and way more food than I can eat in the morning, but the service could not have been better or more cheerful. I forget the name of the breakfast lady, but she was absolutely wonderful. At the end of our one-week stay, a car to the airport was arranged for us. We have recommended this hotel to our friends, and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, intimate, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: RSIsen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel de Lutece twice, each time with one of our granddaughters, and will stay again. Each of our stays has been longer than a week. While the rooms (and elevator, bathroom et al) are small, there is a room ideal for a couple and a child (544). You are in Paris so who cares if space in the hotel room is intimate! The staff is superb. The location: top restaurants, excellent wine shop, fromagerie, bakeries, ice cream, and more stores on the Ile St Louis main little narrow street. My wife, our granddaughters, and I cannot say enough nice things about the hotel, the staff, the location. If you want Holiday Inn Express type rooms, go elsewhere but as for us it is part of a blissful Paris tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , very well situated, great staff”
Reviews.Author: maltoronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a great street...lots of little shops, a bakery and supermarket next door and well situated for touring. The room is small but fine and the bathroom really nice and updated. Staff is amazing. Really go out of their way to be helpful. Had a wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueenEugeneOR
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, the staff, the breakfast, the room, everything. My friend and I stayed for one week in September, 2011 and it is our favorite hotel in Paris,including another on Ile St Louis. We can't say enough about the staff; they were very friendly, helpful and charming, especially Chantee (I am guessing at the spelling), the wonderful lady in the breakfast room. Hotel breakfasts in Paris ARE expensive, but when you consider what you get, especially at this hotel, it is worth it. It is especially worth it to me to have TWO cups of cafe au lait in the morning, not just one when you go to a cafe. You get eggs, ham, cheese, croissants, pain de chocolate, baguette, jams, fresh squeezed orange juice and yoghurt. It was perfect to start us off on our day of sightseeing. The hotel has wonderful ambiance and a very comfortable common area. The room was small, but not unexpected in Paris and particularly in an older building. Beds are generally firmer in Europe than we are used to, but this bed was actually quite comfortable. The street that runs down the center of the Ile is perfect for shopping and eating. And the buskers around the bridge to Notre Dame add to the fun of the area. I loved the accordianist playing Edith Piaf songs! This is the 8th hotel I have stayed in in Paris and it is definitely the best!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: DMCManchester
Reviews.Content: This is it! I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris! The Hotel de Lutece is located on the Ile St. Louis so is right at the heart of Paris. It is small (23 rooms), intimate and quiet. The staff couldn't do enough to make our stay memorable - including quickly responding to my emails to get advance dinner reservations at the Eiffel Tower and suggesting good ways to travel from Gard de Nord to the hotel upon arrival. The lobby is small and beautiful, with a fireplace and comfortable sofas and chairs - there was always a guest sitting and reading! Our room was a delight - plenty of closet space, a large, comfortable bed, floor to ceiling windows that opened out onto Rue St Louis (fabulous!) and a marble tiled bathroom! We walked to Notre Dame and to the Bateau, which we used to travel along the Seine to visit the Louvre, the Champs Elysee and the Eiffel Tower. Exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Mangia46
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Charming decor. A staff that simply cannot do enough for their guests. What more could anyone want?! We love the Hotel de Lutece.

Reviews.Title: “super location right next to Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: Juliette402
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel and its sister one a few doors down the street a few times. The location is fab. Right on the Seine next to Notre Dame. The hotel is ideally based for the metro and sites to easily walk everywhere. Although bit basic in the rooms its clean and has internet and whats needed to make your stay more than acceptable. Lots of Parisian cafes and street restaurants so no need to eat in the hotel. A great little Parisian cafe on the corner where we had fresh croissant and coffee each day. Oh and the most super cheese shop opposite. The street is only a car wide and a cobbled street, A very nice area without the usual price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Great triple!!”
Reviews.Author: TGKimmy
Reviews.Content: Loved our room!! It was perfect for our small family, giving my son his own private room downstairs. The bathroom, though small, was very nice and modern, and with the vanity outside, it helped a great deal with the space issue. The entry area gave ample space for luggage to get it out of the way. Loved the remote control A/C, such that you didn't even have to get out of bed to adjust it! Location was wonderful for the Isle, with a fantastic pastry shop across the street. The staff were so nice, too. I found it to be extremely charming. In fact, I wished we had stayed here the entire time instead of the apartment we switched to! (I have photos of the triple room, but I can't figure out how to upload them here; if anyone is interested, I can e-mail them to you.)

Reviews.Title: “Love the Lutece”
Reviews.Author: sal_slambert
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved our stay at the Lutece. The location is perfect - our room (442) had high ceilings and two windows that opened out onto the street below. We were very happy in our room here - though small, it was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and very modern. We were very happy in the room and the windows and high ceiling definitely made it feel big. I absolutely loved our two windows that overlooked the street below and the nearby rooftops. The staff was a pleasure to work with and the service was great. The hotel is literally in the heart of Paris and getting around is very easy. We walked just about all around the 3rd, 4th, 5th, 6th, 8th, and 11th arrondissements easily from the hotel. The location is truly perfect. (Breakfast was a bit pricy and when I stay at the Lutece again I will probably buy cheese and break across the street instead.) The accommodation, location, and service were all wonderful. I've been staying at the Lutece for about a dozen years with my family and we think it is a gem on the Ile-Saint-Louis. Will definitely be staying here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Janice K
Reviews.Content: For four wonderful nights, my husband and I stayed on the Rue St.- Louis-en-I'lle. The I'lle Saint Louis is a perfect location from which to explore Paris. The Hotel de Lutece is charming, people are friendly, rooms are small but perfectly appointed, the bathroom is large and and the ambience is marvelous. Not more than 4 blocks from Notre Dame, across the Pont St. Louis (which is romanti)c and the Cremerie right across the street is divine! A short walk and you are in Le Marais, by the Metro or around the corner for terrific ice cream! If you stay on the first floor, facing the front, you believe you are truly living in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Paris the way it supposed to be”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiCurt
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with great service. Even though we were 9hrs late, because of the lousy airline, they held our room and had it ready to take a nap. The location is great- bakery, market, cheese shop and deli two minute walk from front door. Nice quite location perfect for relaxing after sightseeing all day. Only draw back it that it is alittle pricey but what isn't in paris. Breakfast is too expensive. Go across the street to get what you want and save abunch.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel; an oasis in the middle of tourist season in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EnglishGranny
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable, the air-conditioning worked, the staff were helpful and friendly. A wonderful place to stay with lots of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Sad and Depressing, Not Charming!”
Reviews.Author: LuvParis4_2
Reviews.Content: Please, please, please do not stay here if you are looking for the charming hotel they show in the photos. The rooms are sad and outdated, whoever took the pictures of this hotel deserves an award! They added flowers and decor in the photos that just did not exist. The beds are very small and low to the ground. I am 5'4" and my feet hung off the edge. The 70's-style furniture is built-in to the cottage cheese covered walls and lacking any character or charm. After putting our luggage in the room the only space left was on the bed. The downstairs lobby would have been a nice retreat, but that too was sad and depressing. It consists of the front desk, a few chairs and one couch facing a fireplace. I tried to tell myself that I had jet lag and in the morning things would be better, but alas in the morning I started crying. This is not the romantic interlude I had planned with my husband or the hotel I had dreamed of staying in. My husband (the greatest in the world) agreed to search out a new hotel with me while we went siteseeing the next day. Much to my delight we came across Hotel de l'Abbaye. It would be $40 Euros more per night, but included breakfast daily in a dreamy glass enclosed room overlooking the most beautiful hotel garden. Since the rooms are small the lobby area has plenty of indoor and outdoor space to relax after a long day of sightseeing. The staff was super friendly and the hotel was everything Paris that I had envisioned. We moved all our luggage across town and finished out our week in true Parisian style. I will add that the showers in Abbaye were a bit strange- a large bathtub with a shower faucet on an old fashioned stand and no curtain, but you get used to it. One more tip we received from the staff at Abbaye: If you call a cab the meter starts running when they leave their current location to come to you. If the meter is showing more than $16 Euros you can refuse that cab.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Lutece - excellent again and again”
Reviews.Author: Keepongoing
Reviews.Content: Returning to this gem of a small hotel is like coming home. Clean bright room, very helpful staff and wonderful location on the Isle St. Louis in the middle of the Seine. This time we were only there overnight en route to the Dordogne and Provence. From this hotel one can walk to the right and left banks, browse a row of boutiques right on the street and choose from a number of excellent restaurants for dinner. Don't forget to sample the Berthillon ice cream for dessert! We recommend breakfast cafe au lait and a basket of baguettes and croissants at one of the cafes overlooking the Seine. We'll be back - again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Petit Hotel in Premier Paris Location!”
Reviews.Author: jbtravels54
Reviews.Content: I took my friend to Paris for her first time, so we splurged on this little hotel on the Ile St. Louis right in the middle of Paris! The view down the little avenue from our 5th floor window was "ooh-la-la so Parisien!", the staff always welcoming, the lobby adorable, (with its ancient stone fireplace and sitting area). The bathroom was huge and modern, and the two bed room accomodated us just perfectly, for three memorable days in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: novaguest
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the Hotel de Lutece surpassed expectations. Our room was ready when we arrived (an unexpected benefit). We were in room 651, which is one of the rooms pictured in the brochure. It had a warm, cozy feel and was quiet - an oasis away from the hubub of Paris. It was surprisingly spacious for a city hotel. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. And, of course, the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CWoodford
Reviews.Content: Heart of Paris. Walk to excellent restaurants. Metro short walk. Easy walk to Latin Quarter (most interesting). easy metro trips to all the sites but quickly back to friendly atmosphere. When you tire of the grandiose, relax near the river. It is a special habitat. Hotel clean. Beds excellent. Staff quick, courteous. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Toadman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nts the second week of March. We felt the room was nice, although not large it was by no means the smallest hotel room we've had in Paris. The bathroom was very nice sized, and had a tub and shower. Although I do not understand why the shower door only extended about 1/2 the length of the tub. The exposed wooden roof beams and high ceilings gave the room a sense of being larger, and there was plenty of closet and storage space for all our luggage. The large windows that opened up to the street were nice. The bed was a bit firm. The heat worked quiet well too. There was a bit of noise that came through in the morning from the street but we only heard a bit of room noise from our neighbor just on one morning. Otherwise it was very quiet. There was also some work being done on the building across the street but they didn't start until after 8AM and it was never an issue as we were out and about during the day. The staff was very friendly. Booked us a restaurant reservation and a taxi and helped with our luggage. We had the breakfast for 13 Euros one day. Small breakfast nook with 3 tables. The breakfast was more than adequate with tea/coffee/hot chocolate/OJ. A small baguette, croissant, ham, hard boiled egg, anad yoghurt were served. Some folks complain about the price for this 3 star hotel but if you know the price up front, and know that the location is truly very good, then I'm not sure why this should be brought up as a negative. I would not hesitate to stay here again the next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LondonCarla69
Reviews.Content: A 3star hotel in a fabulous location. The rooms are small and the decor could do with an overhaul but this is Paris and it is 3star. We booked a triple room which gave 2of us more space and it was perfectly comfortable. The breakfast was very good. Surprisingly the fire in the lobby was never lit which would have added greatly to the charm- if it isn't lit in January when the maximum temperature was 3C I'm not sure when it is! The location is wonderful and the local area has good shops, bars and restaurants as well as the headline attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Berenique
Reviews.Content: Hotel in the heart of the stunning island of Ile Luis, which look and feel more like a small town than the center of Paris. It is close to main attractions and amazingly close to Notre Dame. It is close to metro and RER. Beautiful desk, very friendly and helpful stuff. Rooms from the courtyard rather not pleasant, but on our request our room has been easily changed into much nicer one with a street view. The room, as the Parisian standards, was pretty big with a really big bathroom. We have not try the breakfast, as we prefer to eat in small Café or patisserie, but one of out hotel neighbours told us, the breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LilyXYZ
Reviews.Content: The location on the Isle St Louis is ideal, close to main sights and full of character. The street where the hotel is is full of little shops and restaurants and we ate there as it was too cold to walk far and there was so much choice. The Isle de Vaches restaurant is very good. The hotel is in a fine old building with a very pleasant entrance lounge. But we thought the room was very small for 195 euros, and the bed was also small but comfortable. Good bathroom and lots of storage space, but only one chair. It would be fine for one person but not really roomy enough for two. Breakfast at 13 euros was good value and very generous. On the plus side there was free wifi, though I didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing accommodations, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mahler10
Reviews.Content: The Ile St-Louis is a pretty great place to stay in Paris, although it can get mobbed with tourists in high season. I had to make a quick decision about a hotel at the last minute, and chose this one because it popped up on Trip Advisor as an alternative when the Hotel St-Louis-en-l'Isle was not available. I had stayed at the SLI before, and knew that it was not a beautiful place, but it was very quiet and not too expensive. The prices for the Hotel de Lutece were considerably more, but the photographs made it look like a lovely place to stay. That was my fatal mistake. It turns out that most of the photographs are either of the exterior of the hotel, or of the lobby/common spaces (which are all charming). The ones of the rooms make them all look bright and appealing, with some period furniture. There was no period furniture in either of the double rooms (at 195 Euros a night, not cheap) I was shown upon arrival after having made my reservation, unless you consider the 1960s/1970s period. The room I settled into, after the valet de chambre insisted that the brighter room overlooking the street would be noisy, was nestled in between the stairwell and the elevator, which he insisted I would not be able to hear. I heard both loud and clear while awake, but to be fair it did interfere with my sleep. There was also a "house phone" in the corridor outside my room that would ring frequently (and loudly) in the morning. And my courtyard room could hardly have been much darker. I read some reviews about the breakfasts, saying that they were very good and a good deal, but I'm not sure what they meant. I thought they were pretty skimpy and ordinary, and rather expensive. I went out for an excellent omelet and better coffee two of the four mornings I was there. I did appreciate them getting me "pain complet" (whole-wheat bread) on my last morning, instead of the usual tasteless and nutrition-less white baguette. There are pluses to this hotel. As I said, the location is great. You can get to St-Michel, St-Germain-des-Pres, the Marais and lots of other great neighborhoods very easily. It is also charming to be on a small island in the Seine, and there are many beautiful and historic buildings, including the Hotel de Lutece (on the outside and in the lobby). The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful, accommodating in every way they could be, and that was much appreciated. But it is a shame that a hotel with such great possibilities does not make use of its many advantages (including rooms with high ceilings and charming beams) to create guest rooms that are in keeping with the style of the lovely building and neighborhood, as well as with the fairly high price asked for rooms featuring formica surfaces, short and sagging beds, a closet with metal, locker-style doors, plastic curtains, and 1970s-style carpeting and furniture. Once again, to be fair, the bathrooms had been more recently renovated and were pretty nice. I'm pretty sure the other two hotels I saw on this street -- the de Lutece's sister hotel, the Deux Iles, and the place I stayed before, the Hotel St-Louis-en-l'Isle -- are in the same boat, though at least the SLI is not as expensive. Surely the Ile St-Louis boasts a really nice hotel? Anyway, failing that my advice would be to find a hotel with more charming, tasteful hotel in the 6th or 7th arrondissement.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay in the Hotel do Lutece again”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyGabby
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel de Lutece was lovely. The staff were oh so friendly and helpful. Even help me find a red poppy print! Great location, close to everything. The breakfasts were great, as was the lady who took great pride in serving us. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Did not honor reservation-beware”
Reviews.Author: buddyt
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation for this hotel months ahead for specific rooms that we had stayed in, in the past. When we called to confirm, we were informed that they had given our rooms to someone else and furthermore had no such record that we were to be in them. Shame on them.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem on I'lle St. Louise”
Reviews.Author: luggageinhand
Reviews.Content: Found this little hotel on a previous visit to Paris. Location is the best. Out of the traffic and noise but walking distance to the sites. Our favorite part of Paris is the Ile St. Louis and this little hotel is right where we like to stay. Rooms are small like most Paris hotels. Employees are very kind and helpful. Speak fluent English and enjoy their jobs. Bathrooms clean and modern. Wouldn't stay anywhere else on any future visits to Paris. Special thanks to the wonderful employees for making our stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodation in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 2doglove
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be charming and, on Ile St. Louis, perfectly located for exploring historic Paris. There are also a plethora of restaurants and cafes nearby. The staff was friendly, particularly the lovely woman who prepared breakfast. She made my husband an omelette, which delighted him after days and days without eggs. Our room and bathroom were quite small (think NYC) but we were rarely in our room so for us the location was more important than spacious digs. Based upon the hotel's location and very Parisian feel, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cpp1979
Reviews.Content: a very good hotel, but I couldn't get a single room so I paid for a double (I traveled alone). anyway, it is a good hotel, very well located (the exclusive Ile Saint Louis, what a place!), friendly staff, good breakfast (12 or 14 euros if I remember well), no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the "City of Lights"”
Reviews.Author: kluline
Reviews.Content: As a first time vistior to Paris, I was looking for a hotel that was close to the sites, safe, and had a Parisian feel. Hotel de Lutece meets all three. Located within walking distance to Notre Dame, this hotel is perfectly situated in a quiet and safe neighborhood of the 4th arr. I was pleased to see all of the cafes and shops lining the small streets as I approached the charming hotel. Every encounter with staff was a pleasure; they were always willing to offer assistance with bags, keys or with travel needs. The rooms appeared to be recently renovated and were larger than most European rooms. For my first trip to Paris, the staff at Hotel de Lutece, made it most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: gl0betr0tter24
Reviews.Content: I searched & searched for a reasonably-priced hotel in Paris. Well, my search is over! I found Hotel de Lutece on L'isle Saint Louis. The hotel was small, but quaint. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. The location was fantastic. We were in Room 114, so we didn't have to use the elevator. The room was small, but very well appointed with a HUGE modern (marble) bathroom and a good sized closet. There was no dresser, however, so we could not unpack everything. It was quiet at night. The A/C was superb on a very hot & humid evening in May. Will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small Hotel in idylic location, a real treasure”
Reviews.Author: DandDHobart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights during June 2010, our first trip to Paris. We found the island a great base for further exploration of the city, only a few minutes walk to Notre Dame, tourist bus and metro. We visited a number of fine eateries, boutiques, excellent cheese shops and patisseries on the island. At the Hotel we were fortunate to be allocated a room on the sixth floor which was very spacious, with exposed timber beams and a modern bathroom. The staff were very pleasant, attentive and helpful especially considering our limited knowledge of the french vocabulary. We have stayed in numerous luxury hotels around the world but would certainly choose to stay here again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: LelaKate
Reviews.Content: We found the room pleasant and spacious compared to other Paris hotels in this price range. My only complaint is that the carpet was old and stained and other furnishings seemed dated in the room itself. The lobby was comfortable and the clerk was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, we're booking for next year!”
Reviews.Author: ruthlucy98
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Lutece is located on the Rue St. Louis en Ile, literally across a bridge from Notre Dame Cathedral. The staff were charming and helpful. The hotel itself is quaint and attractive, an old period house, just be warned that the lift is TINY - not for the claustrophobic! and the alternative is a LOT of stair climbing especially if you are located on one of the top floors. The rooms ( well, those we saw) are like most Parisien hotel rooms, compact but in the case of this hotel very well maintained. We had a triple room which turned out to consist of 2 floors connected by stairs and the best thing - we could open all of the 3 windows! A major plus when you want some fresh air. We did have air conditioning too though. A safe in the room was also very useful. The hotel's location is great - on a street crammed with places to eat (and that includes many Berthillon ice cream outlets) or pass the time of day with some people watching and a drink. Retail therapy was also readily available with a selection of the type of cute shops the French do so well, full of gorgeous things you don't actually need but have to have. The hotel is within walking distance of so many well known places such as Notre Dame, st. Chapelle, The Louvre, The Musee d'Orsay, The Sorbonne, The Marais District, The Latin Quarter etc. but the Ile St. Louis feels a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We all loved our stay. BTW: The breakfast , by French standards, is massive! It comprised croissants, bread, pain au chocolat, cheese, jams, yogurt, juice, tea or coffee. And naturally you can ask for specific items if you don't want all of the aforementioned. The service from the lady on duty each morning couldn't have been more pleasant and efficient. In conclusion we liked the Hotel de Lutece so much we're going to revisit it next year.

Reviews.Title: “What an unbelievable find! Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethStreetMoM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a Francophile friend who visits Paris often. In all my many times in Paris I have never been to Isle de la citie. The location is fantastic, very close to Notre Dame, the left bank, the Louvre. My daughter and I walked from the hotel to the Opera house (long, but nice walk). Our room was on the 4th floor in front. We'd open our window each morning and see the charming stores below us. But, the best part for me was: the room was QUIET!! How often does this happen in Paris? I slept so well there because it was quiet, and at night, dark. Then, in the day, open the curtains and light and a nice view. The bathroom was clean and on the modern side. The bedroom itself was tiny, just enough room for the two twin beds, plus a few feet on each side. The tv was excellent plasma tv. The lovely breakfasts in the morning we wonderful as many review have described. The hotel staff was a "can do" type of staff, very friendly, helpful, cheerful, really made you feel at home. Right next door was a grocery store, across the street a FABULOUS cheese shop, up the street the world famous ice cream store. A very charming and quaint street. At the corner I had a lovely drink, again from a friendly, sweet waiter, and my daughter had ice cream. We ate at the Isle restaurant down the street--excellent value and good food; also ate across the street at the Vin Restaurant as recommended by the hotel. That was also charming, and a good value. Neither were terrific food, but very, very good and quite reasonable. I can't wait to go back to Paris and I would without hesitation stay in this hotel. The entire neighborhood is charming and quaint and a real delight. I can't say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The position of this hotel is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: casper009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2009 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms are not the largest but the hotel is full of character and is clean. We would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: bluecato
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Lutece is a small hotel located on the Ile St. Louis in the very center of Paris, perhaps the best location in the city for sightseeing. The lobby is small but comfortable, and the staff was quite friendly and helpful. The room was small, which we expected,but the bed and other pieces of furniture were comfortable. The bathroom was small as well, but large enough for a tub and decorated with marble tile throughout. The continental breakfasts were excellent, though a little expensive. The croissants were especially good and equal to any I have had. One thing Americans should keep in mind is that extra coffee at the hotel is free; you may have to pay for that mug at cafes and brasseries. The only problem we had was that the air conditioning was being repaired the first night and did not work. Unfortunately the street the hotel is on can be very noisy at night during the May-August tourist season, and therefore we really wanted to close the windows. The noise was not a problem once the air conditioning was repaired.

Reviews.Title: “If you plan to stay only one night they may not honour your reservation”
Reviews.Author: APFB
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired at this hotel on a Saturday afternoon after our trip from London to be told that the hotel would not honour the reservation we made some three months earlier after extensive research including visiting the hotel on a previous trip to Paris. We had been really looking forward to staying here and the hotel's location is perfect for exploring Paris. The hotel initially refused any compensation despite the fact that their terms were that a cancellation within 48 hours of the date of arrival would result in a cancellation fee of one night's stay. They had most kindly (yes my American friends this is sarcasm) made a reservation for us in the Hotel Notre Dame which I suspect the owner of the Lutece may also own. We didn't darken the door of it but judging by its position - on a main road and not on the Island - and its outward appearance, I wouldn't put up my worst enemy's cat in it.. After my Taiwanese other half spent an hour on the phone with the owner we eventually managed to get the owner to pay for breakfast at another far better four star hotel on the Island. Not even that went smoothly though because the receptionist at the Lutece (decorative but not much else) represented to us that the other hotel would accept a piece of paper on which they had scrawled that the Lutece would pay for our breakfast. They hadn't and they wouldn't. Eventually we got the receptionist at the Lutece to hand over $40 in cash. This ruined the first day of our trip and accordingly I couldn't possible recommend this establishment, which made Fawlty Towers look like a Hilton, to anybody I cared about. I contrast this experience to one I had in Budapest a couple of years ago. There the hotel we had booked had forgotten to inform Expedia that rooms were not available. In fact they found us a room but it was dingy and we asked to be moved to another room. Instead of arguing for a hour like Monsieur Grand in Paris they immediately booked us into the Hilton, a better hotel, paid for the room there and paid for a taxi to take us to it. It is a shame when greed overcomes customer service as it did at Hotel Lutece.

Reviews.Title: “A quaint and nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelynfromOC
Reviews.Content: A very nice and quaint place to stay. I would stay here again. A nice quiet location on Isle St. Louis. Very nice for walking everywhere. Across the street is a fabulous cheese shop, a boulangerie with fresh bagettes. The street is very lively with all types of restaurants and very nice shops. The rooms are small as most in Paris with a nice bathroom. Very clean. Ask for a street side room as it is fun to look over onto the lovely quaint street that is mostly all foot traffic. It was very comfortably and quiet for sleeping. The staff was very nice and helpful if you needed directions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Small treasure”
Reviews.Author: Sevenoaks60
Reviews.Content: Ideal central location in beautiful area of Paris. Small, friendly hotel. Well run . Rooms small but well furnished. Nice sized bathroom. Excellent breakfast in tiny breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Keepongoing
Reviews.Content: As always this charming hotel contributed to a wonderful stay in Paris. We have stayed here several times and would not stay anywhere else in Paris. The location, staff and comfortable room keep enticing us back to this hotel. Located so that both the Leftbank and Rightbank areas are within easy walking access, this hotel is surrounded by boutiques, food shops and restaurants. What a pleasure after a day's sightseeing to be able to step outside and have a choice of reasonably priced places to eat. Thank you Hotel De Lutece for contributing to our wonderful memories of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GottagonowChicago
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, spacious room and bathroom, helpful staff. I suggest eating breakfast out, their breakfast was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Paris_and_beyond
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Lutece (***) (and its sister hotel, Hotel deux Iles, also (***)) — in the 4th arrondissement, are very near each other on the beautiful Ile St. Louis. We love this little island, upstream from the Ile de la Cite. Its downsteam point provides a great view of the backside of Notre Dame. The Ile St. Louis is especially beautiful at night when the crowds leave and the island is bathed in incandescent light. Websites: hotel-ile-saintlouis.com (a shared site for the two hotels) See also, for more photos: http://www.myhotelinparis.com/hotels2/) Note: In the summer, the the island can be lest restful; we enjoy it most in the late fall and winter, when the crowds are thinner. -- Jake (http://parisandbeyondinfrance.blogspot.com)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TakesTrips
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent boutique hotel. It’s not the Ritz, but it’s not supposed to be. The location is excellent, the center of the Ile St. Louis. The island itself is charming. Rue St. Louis is lined with lovely shops, restaurants, and galleries. There is a super market right beside the hotel, and a boulangerie with bread and pastries across the street. You can easily grab a great breakfast, cheaply, from these two shops, or go to one of several cafes on the island. It is an easy walk to Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, and the Marais district (Place des Vosges). To get to the Louvre, you can easily access the pink #7 line of the Paris metro at the Pont Marie stop on the Right Bank, if you do not wish to walk to the museum. A short walk to the St. Michel metro stop will take you to the d’Orsay, Eiffel Tower, and Versailles via the RER C line, without transferring. The St. Michel metro stop has a ticket window where you can buy your train ticket to Versailles. Our room at Hotel de Lutece was great (#661, top floor, street side). The room was large, considering the size of most Paris hotel rooms. Large windows opened up for fresh air. There was enough room for two people to move around, and also a small table and chairs, and desk. There was enough room to spread out a bit and place luggage. The bathroom was wonderful—spacious enough for two people, with enough counter space for two persons’ toiletries and two large mirrors, one over a vanity area. It had a shower bath. There was a towel bar in front of the sink to hold two hand towels. Best of all, there was a multi-rung heated towel rack, handy in case you needed to rinse something out. (Bring hair conditioner if you need; Paris hotels do not necessarily provide.) The lobby is warm and charming. It was pretty busy, with guests and business (both guest and non-guest) being conducted. Check-in is at 2:00 and if you arrive early the staff tries to accommodate. Service staff were usually very cordial and professional. There are many fine restaurants on the island to choose from, in various price ranges. Everything we had was very good. Beware of lower priced “menu” offerings listed on the “carte” that are not available in the evening hours. Don’t miss Berthillon ice cream, possibly the best on earth. On our last day, we enjoyed an afternoon WWII walk (Classic Walks) that left from the bridge that links the island to Notre Dame island, very convenient. We would definitely stay here again. Great location and charm.

Reviews.Title: “A delight”
Reviews.Author: MacWales_UK
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, the building is old and beautiful Paris with antique furniture in the reception area. The staff were courteous and helpful. We had a great 4 night stay. The room was a little small, but had a large modern bathroom. We were at the back of the building so it was quiet but had no view. Breakfast was better than usual for France, delicious croissants, pain au chocolat, FRESH orange juice, jam, yoghurt, fruit (banana or apple at this time of year) - even egg, cheese and meat if you need it!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay at the Lutece”
Reviews.Author: Upsilon6
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the Lutece in a clean, decent-sized room with a bathroom that was large by Paris standards. The location speaks for itself, on a historic island that is itself a tourist attraction. The staff was friendly and efficient, even looking up the English language equivalent to a French dish. (Seiche is cuttlefish in case you are interested.) Guests at the Lucece can use the free Internet computer at the nearby Deux Iles Hotel. I have in the past stayed at the Deux Iles and would happily stay at either hotel again, although the Lutece in my experience has the larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “do not confuse this hotel with the Best Westeren Lutece#!!!”
Reviews.Author: katheann
Reviews.Content: I have been reading reviews on this website and realized that the two hotels Lutece have been combined in to one site. The hotel on the Isle de cite is the non=Best Western Lutece and if one reads the reviews carefully it is obvious that the Best Western Lutece is the inferior hotel. We spent 3 very happy nights at the Hotel Lutece on the Isle de cite. The room is nicely decorated, the bathroom is a dream for a Paris hotel and the ambience in the lobby and the room is lovely. The street is very quiet and you are about 200 metres at most from Notre Dame and a Metro stop. The location couldn't be better. How can you go wrong staying in the oldest part of the city? As a bonus, the pillows are very comfy which is important in a French hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MI_Traveler2
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris, and after a very hectic day of travel we arrived at the Hotel De Lutece. I had my concerns after reading some reviews on this website, but we were thrilled with the hotel. Arriving in the lobby was like stepping into a little oasis after our hectic trip. The receptionist spoke excellent English and the entire staff was helpful. The elevator was extremely small, but this is a 200+ year old building so we were grateful there was an elevator. Our room was among the smallest we stayed in on our trip, but was very charming, comfortable, and had quite a large bathroom. The location was fantastic - just a couple blocks to the Notre Dame. The air conditioning was quiet and effective, and free wifi was available in the room. Breakfast was an extra cost, and was quite good, although we chose to eat at the yummy pastry shop across the street the second day. On the day we left for the airport, it was pouring rain and the woman on reception duty went above and beyond to help us find a last minute shuttle for the airport (even though we were supposed to have booked that in advance). Great staff, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: rpchicago
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and Paris did not disappoint. It was beautiful. Unfortunately, our hotel was not. I did extensive research and had booked us at four hotels, but chose the Lutece because of the location. The location was perfect, but unfortunately, the hotel was not. I was prepared for a small room, and I had written and asked for one of the rooms on the top floors because Trip Advisor's reviews said they were the largest with the most light. If our room had the most light and was one of the largest, I would hate to see what the other rooms looked like. By the way, we knew the reviews on Trip Advisor were mixed, but we chose the neighborhood. We asked for and got two twin beds, but don't be fooled--these are not your normal twin beds--they are smaller and pushed together. There was room for my husbands suitcase on the floor by his side of the bed, but no room for mine. The room was small, dark and not nicely furnished. The bathroom, however, was pretty large and we were lucky we had a bathtub--some of the rooms did not. I asked if they had a larger room and they were happy to show me the other rooms they had available, but they were worse. We were in room 332 and 333 and 334 were worse (one double bed and no tub). The breakfast room was small and dark, but we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as there were many places within walking distance. The ile St Louis is a charming and beautiful street that is also home to Berthillion Ice cream (not to be missed) and many little shops and wonderful places to eat. We wanted to stay at the Jeu de Paume, but with the weak dollar, we could not afford it. We didn't spend much time in the room (too claustrophobic). We have traveled extensively and knew the room would be small, but it wasn't even charming; it was just too small. Natalie at the front desk was wonderful, however, and recommended a terrific restaurant for our last night and helped us with whatever we needed. We would definitely stay in this area again, but definitely not this hotel. If you are traveling alone, the room would be ok, but spend the extra money and stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In An Even Better Location”
Reviews.Author: KarenBCork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location for a quick break. I've stayed in Paris several times, so this time it was a relief not to have to get taxis so much. It is surrounded by several metro stops, i used the one outside Notre Dame the most. This is a neighbourhood, within a city. All the cafes are filled with parisiens grabbing their morning coffee. Everyone knows one another, which was great! This hotel is not glamourous but friendly, clean and full of character. My room looked over the rooftops with exposed beams and a huge marble bathroom. It is exactly like the website picture! Ignore the breakfast comments! To be honest, you wouldn't want to have breakfast there with all those great pattissieres on your door-step. Hardly any hotels in Paris have good breakfasts, except 5 Stars! Great Hotel within an even better neighbourhood...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lutece”
Reviews.Author: Beckstar1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at the Lutece in October 2007 and we loved it. It's a very typical Parisian hotel with odd shaped rooms and small nooks and crannies but the overall effect is charming. The hotel staff were very helpful and eager to please, and our room was comfortable, although the bathroom was tiny. The location of the hotel is great - very central and within walking distance of Notre Dame and the rue de Rivoli - and a very romantic setting on the Ile St Louis. I would recommment the Lutece and will definately be staying there on future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But...”
Reviews.Author: echoes081177
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, but we had some problems. We booked months in advance and, when we checked in, they said that the a/c in our room was being repaired and they sent us to a sister hotel , Hotel Henri IV in the Rive Gauche district, for one night. This hotel was fine, but it was a big inconvenience because we had to switch hotels (the hotel paid for the cabs both ways) twice. We found out from the Henri IV that the a/c wasn't broken, but the people who had occupied our room before wanted to extend their stay. I don't know why they could not have been honest about it. Secondly, I didn't catch is name, but one of the guys working the front desk was sort of aloof. We would ask him a question about something simple (where can we have a coffee and croissant, for example) and he would ask us if we wanted something totally different. We asked him one night where a good restaurant was and he was helpful in finding a place for us. He asked if he wanted us to make a reservation. We said yes and then he completely forgot, even after we reminded him twice. We finally said forget and went somewhere on our own. Anyway, the room was nice and the location is fantastic. Just be prepared to stay in another hotel for a night or so upon check in, as availability is not always guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Ile St. Louis hotel”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for a double room and kept checking with the hotel over 6 months time to see if I could have one of the top floor rooms. Hotel kept coming back with negatives but said they'd do their best for me. Upon check-in, I walked into a warm, lovely lobby with wood panels and a fireplace and decorated with poinsettias. Madame at reception gave me a triple room that was on the 5th floor (room #53) overlooking some rooftops. Very very quiet room. Had a small alcove with an extra bed hence the triple room. Bathroom was a good size with bidet. Shower stall is small and needs some refurbishing due to some mold in between the tiles but otherwise, was excellent. Has a normal hairdryer Breakfast is 10 euro (continental) but this is not the usual baguette & croissant/coffee or tea b'fast. The server, a very kind Indian woman, gives you extra and is very accomodating. The croissant is huge and so is the baguette. The coffee-oh my God-is so good. It's strong but not so strong to be absolutely bitter. And it's a huge pot with another huge pot of steamed milk. Plus you receive a nice glass of fresh-squeezed orange juice. The best part is the hotel's location to Notre Dame-just 2 1/2 short blocks. How can you beat that? Also my favorite restaurant, Le Tastevin, is a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable availability at check-in”
Reviews.Author: georgiapeach021
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is charming and in a very desirable area of Paris, we had occassion to stay there two times in June. These reservations were made in February and confirmed in May. Both times,upon checking in, the hotel clerk advised us that there was no room for us and offered us a room down the street at their sister hotel. This was a less desirable hotel and although they made an adjustment in price, we were traveling with others and it became an inconvenience as well as a disappointment to be sent down the street, especially when the room was not ready there, either. We eventually got into Hotel Lutece, but that of course, involved re-packing luggage and moving.

Reviews.Title: “overbooked”
Reviews.Author: jerrykevan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in March for my tenth wedding anniversary. When we arrived in July we were advised that the hotel was overbooked and they moved us to a sister hotel a mile or so away. The alternate hotel was very nice but I will not use yhem again because of the overbooking. There was very little apology and no mention of any sort of refund for inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: missfine
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time in Paris and my best hotel experience thus far. While all Paris hotels are small and relatively expensive - this one boasted a great location, helpful and friendly staff and CLEAN simple rooms. You're in the heart of the action and everything is within walking distance - not to mention you are surrounded by dozens of authentic restaurants. If you want style and luxury stay at Le Meurice - but if you want a dependable, affordable place to rest your head, stay at the Hotel de Lutece. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Lutece only ok”
Reviews.Author: Robby
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based upon positive reviews here and in two different guide books. I must say that the location is excellent. It is easy to walk everywhere. There are numerous cafes, restaurants, and litlle shops and food stores close by. The bathroom was small but clean and all things were close at hand. On the downside, we found the staff to be rather indifferent. Our room was small as expected. The bed was in the corner against a wall so it was difficult to get up at night without disturbing the other person. The room was not charming but very bland. Based upon pictures I expected some old world charm. If there is breakfast served we were never told of it. I would stay in this area again but not at this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MacInCt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de Lutece with my 14 year old daughter in April. We had stayed previously (and subsequently) at the "sister" hotel, Hotel des Deux Iles, which is close by in the same street. For some observations on the neighborhood, which we love, please take a look at my review of the Hotel des Deux Isles. The two hotels are very similar. Hotel de Lutece may be a little bit nicer and is a few Euro more a night. In both cases the rooms are tiny, the closets tinier and the bathrooms relatively large. The hotels are both clean and well-kept and the staff at the "front desk" (literally a desk near the door) is friendly and helpful. The best thing about this hotel is the location. The Isle St. Louis is charming and fun. There are lots of restaurants and shops nearby and it is a five-ten minute walk to Notre Dame and a choice of metro stops. We will certainly stay in this hotel (or it's sister down the street) again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Lutece Too!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLinda
Reviews.Content: We always stay on Ile St Louis and just love the Lutece. The location is terrific and romantic. Front desk is very helpful, great bakery directly across the street, little grocery next door, many fine restaurants and sights nearby. Don't forget the Berthillon sorbets!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: itzmered
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room. Although we were on the inside and did not have any type of view, the room was quite spacious by European standards. Beds were comfortable. It had a nice size bathroom with a great shower. The staff was very helpful. It was just a short walk (2 blocks) to Notre Dame and with the windows open you could hear the bells chiming. If you cross the bridge into St. Germain you will find a wonderful area full of cute little shops and lots of restaurants. We especially enjoyed the street Rue de Hutchette, it was full of restaurants many of them served greek food. Good food and inexpensive. There is a stop for the Batobus by Notre Dame and you can also board the Double decker sightseeing buses at Notre Dame. We also stayed at another hotel on our return to Paris and wished we had stayed at the Hotel de Lutece again. We really enjoyed our stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: giantkatestacks
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two-night stay at the Hotel Lutece on the Ile St Louis and can happily say that it was a great choice - I had done loads of research before booking - looking for a romantic hotel in a good location and it fulfilled everything I was looking for. Ok granted it didn't have bathrobes and room service but there was air conditioning and a truly special attic room - ask for one of the two rooms on the 6th floor for more light and a more romantic feel. The front desk booked restaurants for us and were really friendly - not intimidating at all and the area was full of great food shops and restaurants and two minutes away from notre dame and the latin quarter and the plage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, noisy street”
Reviews.Author: SunshineDaydream
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, typically sized rooms, with a very nice remodeled bathroom. They apparently just remodeled a number of rooms ... this one was a good size for paris. The only negative was our room was right on the street, which was quaint and romantic at 2 in the afternoon, but less so at 2 in the morning when we could hear lots of noise from the street below. Ile Saint Louis is a good location in the middle of everything -- quaint street with a wonderful fromagerie and boulangerie right across the street from the hotel, and a great little market right next door. A bit removed from the Metro lines, but other than that a wonderful place to start our first trip to Paris. Staff was helpful and friendly ... and a breath of fresh air after our ill fated arrival at the deux iles down the street (see my review of that one if you're curious about the episode)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrevorandClaire
Reviews.Content: Chose Hotel de Lutece after reading lots of info on the different areas in Paris, and lots of hotel reviews. It sounded ideal for my post-engagement present to my girlfriend - and indeed it was; it lived up to all the positive reviews. The island is great - quiet and romantic, away from the more hectic Marais or Saint-Germain but close enough for easy access, and with lovely quays and views all around. The staff were warm and welcoming, and the room (111)was great - a view of the street, immaculate newly referbished bathroom with good shower and bath, beamed ceiling and tasteful decoration. The rooms are not huge, but I think that's pretty normal for Paris, especially in a building of this age. The only problem was some loud-ish music from some kids across the road on the 2nd night, which was a bit annoying, but I think it was something of an exception on a normally very peaceful street. It stopped by 1am, and was quite successfully masked by shutting our window anyway. The new prices (207 euros per night including breakfast for two) would perhaps seem expensive for what you get in any other location - but the Ile Saint Louis is renound for being exclusive and pricey, and is so nice, I think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff problems and noise”
Reviews.Author: AndrrewB
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Lutece. On both occasions we found the hotel itself to be full of charm and character. Sure the rooms are small but that's not unusual for Paris, at least they are well arranged and don't feel cramped, the bathrooms are better than many I've seen too. HOWEVER on the send night of our stay we were kept awake by a persistent very low-pitch hum. The night guy on the desk made some effort to see what he could do, to no avail. We eventually figured out ourselves that the noise was highly localised and we ended up having to drag the bed to a different part of the room away from the noise, even this was only partially effective. When we checked out the following morning the guy on the desk knew nothing of our complaints overnight, and was relatively indifferent, but did reveal that they have problems with noisy neighbours playing music - worth knowing about! I don't know why the noise didn't keep us awake the first night, but the second night was unbearable and I wouldn't take the risk of staying in this hotel again even though it is well placed, charming, and relatively good value (except for breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLin
Reviews.Content: We stayted here Oct 6-12 and were very pleased with our room. We were on the 3rd floor facing the street. The room was small by American standards but average by European standards. The bathroom was very nice w/double sinks and tub & shower, very roomy. The towels were large and fluffy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate at the hotel 2 of the 5 days that we were there and found the croissants, jam, bread, juice and coffee very good. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again. The location was wonderful and we felt very safe walking the streets at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Oct 1-3 and loved it! The rooms are small but the bathrooms are nice sized and very clean. We were in 111 and 114. 111 has a nice view out to the street. The staff was very attentive, and recommended an incredible resturant. The best part is the location. You are on a street w/ a Market downstairs, a creamery across the street, a bakery a few doors down, the butchers down the other way, an ATM one block up, 10 small botique shops and another 5-7 resturants. All on the same 3 blocks of street. VERY convienient. They said they served breakfast, but we never bothered, w/ the bakery and cafe's so close. Crepes and croisants for breakfast! Well worth the modest 164Euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Lutece!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in late September and had a wonderful time. We were in Room 661 (top floor -- the lift goes to the 5th floor, and then there is small, winding staircase to the 6th floor), which overlooked the rooftops of Paris. The room was larger than I expected, based on reviews -- we had a double bed, table with two chairs, desk, and there was also a rollaway bed tucked under the eaves. The room had dark wooden beams and bright, cheerful duvet and curtains. The bathroom was spotless and modern, and had a built-in hairdryer. Hotel staff was helpful in making dinner reservations for us. We booked the hotel via email and confirmed the reservation about a month out, which all seemed to go smoothly. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel, but the breakfast room looked tiny. The Ile St. Louis is an ideal location (close to Cite and Pont Marie metro stops) -- we didn't want to leave the island! Delicious chocolate shop right next door to the hotel, fromagerie across the street, several patisseries and little gourmet markets (including an all-foie-gras shop!), art galleries, and interesting shops. Our favorite meal on the island was at l'Îlot Vache -- some kitschy cows in the window, but lovely and romantic inside, with gorgeous flowers, candles, and gleaming copper pots -- great terrine, duck, seafood, and chocolate mousse. And we got engaged there!! But I would have loved it regardless. Overall, a spectacular vacation in Paris, enhanced by our experience at Hotel de Lutece.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kimncris
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights and never had a problem. They have wireless internet access which is great. You can buy a meteor card for 25 Euros and you get 24 hours of access (it doesn't have to be all in a row as long as you log out every night) They are very close to just about everything in Paris since they are practically dead center. Notre Dame is about 2-3 short blocks away. The Metro stop Pont Marie is right across the river and with Chatelet one stop away you can basically get anywhere with minimal changing of trains (yet we reccommend avoiding Chatelet whenever possible due to the long tunnels, but anyway...) Since the hotel is on Ile St Louis it is smack in the center of dozens of great restaurants and food shops within very short walks including FROMAGER B. LEFRANC who has the greatest cheese and is a joy to talk to. The hotel is just few short blocks from La Taverne de la Sergent Recruteur, our new favorite restaruant and Amorino gelati which while not as famous as the Berthillon ice cream was just as good and open much later! There is a "super marche" right next door for those late night cravings or random picnic supplies that you might have missed at one of the specialty shops. The staff speaks english. Our room #223 which was on the 3rd floor had exposed wood beams on the ceiling and faced a little courtyard rather than the street, so noise was at a minimum. It was a little bit small, but we are used to that in europe and the double consisted of 2 twin beds pushed together(which was kind of nice since one person tossing and turning did not disturb the other). On the other hand, the bathroom was really large in comparison and had awesome water pressure and a hair dryer. There was also a safe in our room and air conditioning. FYI There IS an elevator, but it is tiny, so most days we just used the stairs. If we can afford the rates 164 per night in Sept 05 we would definitely love to stay at Hotel De Lutece again in the future.
